concept.title: Create a Volume from a Snapshot

conbody.p: A snapshot can be used to create a new volume in a cluster. When a snapshot is taken of a volume, the Storage Controller caches the snapshot before transferring it to the Walrus. If a new volume is created from that snapshot, the Storage Controller can use its cache rather than have to download the snapshot from the Walrus. This saves time and network bandwidth. If the new volume to be created is located in another cluster, then the Storage Controller in that cluster must download the snapshot from the Walrus.
The snapshot is cached on the Storage Controller at /var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/snap-<nnnnnnnn>.
